post.author: 이진경
post.content:
SENIOR PROJECT MANAGER
Community, Family and Children's Services


$64314.00 - $81113.00 / annually

Location: Toronto
Area of Search:

Join the Ministry of Community, Family and Children's Services, human services I&IT cluster, community and social services programs I&IT branch, to manage application maintenance and development projects, lead project teams and ensure successful completion of all phases from analysis to implementation. You will: determine appropriate methodologies, techniques, tools; manage project ensuring time lines, budget, quality standards are met; provide contract management for third party providers; manage risks, quality, continuous improvement for developing, implementing, supporting IT business applications

Qualifications: expertise in languages, concepts/tools of software IT environments; knowledge of current IT concepts/tools applicable to mainframe/web-browser technology, IT development management, project management, Ontario Public Service policies/procedures (business case development, project approvals, systems development); leadership, analytical, problem-solving, decision-making, communication, interpersonal, negotiation skills.


Apply by Jun 14, 2002 to: File HSC/M-602B, Human Services I&IT Cluster, Human Resources Unit, Ministry of Community, Family and Children's Services, 101 Bloor St. W., 11th Fl., Toronto, ON M5S 2Z7. Fax: 416-314-5400. E-mail: HSC.Resume@css.gov.on.ca. Only applicants selected for an interview will be contacted.
post.title: SENIOR PROJECT MANAGER
